165_P_BC_CP_2.name: Equipment Status
165_P_BC_CP_2.desc: Reflects the current state of circuits, features, bodies, and equipment attached to the OCP.

payload.name: Panel Time
payload.desc: Current time hours reported from the OCP.

payload.name: Panel Time
payload.desc: Current time minutes reported from the OCP.

payload.name: Circuit States
payload.desc: Bit flags for up to 40 aux circuits

payload.name: Feature States
payload.desc: Upper 4 bits contain the first 4 feature states.  Lower 4 bits are undefined.

values.1: The configuration item is extended options

165_P_CP_V_82.name: Ping OCP for an address
165_P_CP_V_82.desc: The valve will ping the OCP for an address when it is on the bus.

payload.name: Line
payload.desc: The line that is displayed on the controller

16_3_0.name: Set Chlorinator Control
16_3_0.desc: Sets the chlorinator control to the OCP.  This message is required to maintain the control of the chlorinator.

16_3_1.name: Control Acknowlegement
16_3_1.desc: Indicates that the chlorinator is now being controlled by the OCP.

16_3_3.name: Control Acknowlegement
16_3_3.desc: Indicates that the chlorinator is now being controlled by the OCP.

16_3_17.name: Set the output on the chlorinator
16_3_17.desc: Sets the chlorinator's output based upon the values in the payload

16_3_18.name: Status Response
16_3_18.desc: Response from the chloriator indicating the current status an salt level.

16_3_20.name: Get chlorinator model
16_3_20.desc: Request from the OCP to get the model of the chlorinator.

165_P_PMP_CP_1.name: Set pump drive speed and flow
165_P_PMP_CP_1.desc: Sets the rpm and/or flow of the pump.  This message is sent to take control of the pump and disable the local control panel on the drive.

165_P_CP_PMP_1.name: Response to setting the speed or flow.
165_P_CP_PMP_1.desc: This message is in response to the pump speed or flow being set.

165_P_PMP_CP_4.name: Set pump run state
165_P_PMP_CP_4.desc: Sets the run state pf the pump.  This message is sent to take control of the pump and disable the local control panel on the drive.

165_P_CP_PMP_4.name: Response to setting the run state.
165_P_CP_PMP_4.desc: This message is in response to the pump run state being set.  A return of 255 indicates that the local control panel on the drive has been disabled.

165_P_PMP_CP_5.name: Set pump drive feature
165_P_PMP_CP_5.desc: Sets the feature state of the pump.  This message is sent to set the .

165_P_CP_PMP_5.name: Response to setting the drive feature.
165_P_CP_PMP_5.desc: This message is in response to the pump drive feature being set.

165_P_PMP_CP_6.name: Set pump drive state
165_P_PMP_CP_6.desc: Sets the run state pf the pump.  This message is sent to take control of the pump and disable the local control panel on the drive.

165_P_CP_PMP_6.name: Response to setting the drive state.
165_P_CP_PMP_6.desc: This message is in response to the pump drive state being set.

165_P_PMP_CP_7.name: Get pump status
165_P_PMP_CP_7.desc: Broadcast request to get the current running status of the pump.

165_P_CP_PMP_7.name: Pump status response
165_P_CP_PMP_7.desc: Broadcast request to get the current running status of the pump.

165_P_PMP_CP_10.name: Sets the speed or flow on the pump
165_P_PMP_CP_10.desc: Pump request to set the pump speed or flow.

165_P_CHM_CP_210.name: Get IntelliChem status
165_P_CHM_CP_210.dest: Request to get the status from IntelliChem

165_P_CHM_CP_146.dest: Set options on the IntelliChem controller

165_P_CHM_CP_210.dest: Request to get the status from IntelliChem

165_P_CP_V_82.name: Ping OCP for an address
165_P_CP_V_82.desc: The valve will ping the OCP for an address when it is on the bus.
